text.p: Anadarko Petroleum Corp said Wednesday it signed an exploration license agreement with Perupetro SA, a Peruvian government entity.

The agreement gives Anadarko the right to explore Block 84 over a seven-year exploration period consisting of five phases, the company said. Block 84 is a 2.55 million acre area in the Ucayali Basin in east-central Peru, near Brazil.

Anadarko said Phase I covers two and one-half years during which the company is committed to spend about $5 million to acquire a minimum of 600 kilometers of seismic survey. Plans include an aerial magnetic survey of Block 84.
This survey will help determine locations for the seismic acquisition program scheduled for 1997, Anadarko said.
PeruPetro negotiates exploration and production contracts on behalf of Peruvian goverment with foreign oil companies.
